title: Good value, basic guest house
review: Little choice for breakfast and limited food and drink offering. Budget guest house in good location, central to Remera, with friendly staff. Comfortable, if simple, bed with fixed mosquito net.

title: Great location, clean & affordable.
review: I had a hard time finding the guesthouse.  The taxi driver had no idea where it was, even though I gave him the streets it was near.  None of the residents nearby knew of it.  And, the phone number on the email was incorrect.  However, after I found it, I was very happy with it. I stayed here for its location, close to Amahoro Stadium, where the marathon began & ended.  The staff was very accommodating - cooking an extra early breakfast for me (omelette, bread & coffee) and allowing me a late check-out so I could leave my bag there during the marathon and check out after finishing the race.

title: I would deftly go back again.
review: not too many channels on Tv excellent accommodation for the price Nice view from the terrace, quiet and safe area, free parking. Nice staff, large and clean room, cheap price. at the entertainment area of the town convenient location, 5 minutes walk from stadium, 20 minutes walk to the market (or 5 minutes on a moto-taxi).the staff will call you a taxi if you need one Hot water was available all day Breakfast was simple toasts, oily margarine and peanut butter, omelette, tea or coffee (well, we took tea and coffee with no additional cost). Wifi is good all the staff was helpful I would deftly go back again.

title: The staff were very friendly.
review: The WiFi was on and off. The owner very distant ( trying not to use rude)from clients. I even thought he was one of the guests, shock on me when I realised he was the owner The staff were very friendly. They were also very helpful about directions since we were foreigners.

title: The property was hard to find because the sign out front is...
review: The property was hard to find because the sign out front is not marked with the new name of the facility. It took my taxi driver three calls to the proprietor before we were able to locate the property. Other than that, it was excellent. And now that I know where it is, I will be back. None

title: Good accomodation for the price, nice staff.
review: Not easy to find, our taxi looked for the place during 20 minutes, calling 4 different persons. We could ear the noisy occupants of other rooms, some of them seemed to enjoy the evening very much (and the morning too)! Hot water was not available the first morning (but ok in the evening and the second day). Breakfast was really basic: toasts, oily margarine and peanut butter, omelette, tea or coffee (well, we took tea and coffee with no additional cost). Nice view from the terrace, quiet and safe area, free parking. Nice staff, large and clean room, cheap price. Not very central but convenient, 5 minutes walk from stadium, 20 minutes from market (or 5 minutes on a moto-taxi).

review: Bathroom had broken showers, missed towel first night. Room floor was shaky. Staff not prepared to handle guests from English speaking nations. The rest area in my launch was great. Meals were great.

title: Excellent! Amazing!
review: The only small disappointment was in the morning when we left without breakfast as it wasn't ready and the fruits that they have didn't look fresh. I arrived very late at night and I noticed that the hotel manager actually offered to pick us up from the airport at an extra cost. I quickly emailed without any hope but I was so impressed when he got back to me straight away confirming that he will be able to pick us up! As I was confused as to how am I going to be able to identify him at the arrivals. I was blown away when I was still playing confused.com there he way carrying a board with my full name!Staff were super friendly and helpful, the room was so clean and the balcony was out of this world! I will definitely stay there again next year and I will recommend this hotel to everyone I know.

title: Noisy (Jets, traffic and revellers) till the early hours, saved only by nice caring staff
review: Noise - lots of it. First due to it's proximity to the airport Jets can be heard taking off and landing up to 2.30am, then there is a Bar downstairs open to the public which is lively to say the least. The Hotel is situated on a busy road and the Car Park at the front seems to be a public free for all. Noise in the evenings was frankly close on appalling - unless of course you live above Oxford street (London) in which case you'd be right at home!! Double glazing poor and ineffective, not enough use of insecticide so a great place to be bitten and under sheet dirty with blood stains . . . need I say more? One member of staff; Georgina was quite simply exceptional and made our stay fantastic. Her attention to detail and caring attitude made us feel tremendously welcome and she turned a very mediocre experience into one we shall remember fondly.

title: Excellent place to stay in Kigali
review: Air-conditioning is an obvious area for upgrading in the hotel. In the meantime, a fan in the room would be good. Good location with lovely views over the city at the back (do ask for a 'valley view' room!). Rooms large, clean and quite comfortable. A decent size balcony with a table and two chairs was real asset. Bathroom quite small but functional and clean. Buffet breakfast was very good. The restaurant is just downstairs from reception and there is a very nice terrace area with a great view to sit to have a drink or eat. Staff very friendly and keen to please. Easy transfers from and to airport.

title: Convinient location
review: The rooms on the road side need noise proofing. Breakfast was fair and basic. Location was good but being on the road side room was uncomfortable because of the noise from the traffic.

review: The location is a bit off the road and little difficult to find. Rest everything was Great. Very neat and clean. Good Service. Good staff. Thanks for a nice stay.

title: Basic  accommodation and out of the way location
review: The advertisement said it was a suite with 2 beds and a sofa bed. That was not the case at all.  It was one open room with a kingsize bed only. There was a small curtain for the open shower and likewise for the toilet. Some of the pictures associated with the room are correct but the ones showing an enclosed bathroom are not correct for that room.  I spoke to the young guy who was working there about it and encouraged him to correct the mistakes.  He was helpful but not very friendly.  Might be a language issue. Bed was very comfortable and room was clean. Adequate breakfast and internet.

title: Quiet neighbourhood, a few small restaurants around but most...
review:
It was difficult to find. No number given in address or name sign on property. Once you get to the street. It is number 13 and has white security gates.
Not too many people staying here.  Quiet neighbourhood, a few small restaurants around but most you will need to walk a while or get a Moto.
Local shops along the street to get some nice fruit and veg.
We were able to use the kitchen to cook a meal.

title: Such a nice place
review: None We loved the outdoor views and the bungalow had enough space for our group, internet was really good and unlimited, local shops are in the neighborhood, it was a great experience to shop like a local and the ride on moto taxi too.

title: A bit like Fawlty Towers, except that we never saw Basil - and Manuel was in charge!
review: The breakfast should be improved. We had Nescafé, cold toast and margarine with no jam etc. There was fruit salad, which was nice. Real coffee should be provided, along with decent bread/pastries/pancakes with honey/jam and the option of omelettes. Staff were very pleasant but had limited English or French language skills: this led to embarrassing confusion with other guests over access to a shared bathroom, booked as a private bathroom. Nice little garden and quiet location. Has potential if significant improvements are made.

title: Underwhelming. We had hoped it would be a quiet bead and breakfast style place. Won't go again.
review: Location is hard to find. Managment is absent for the most part. You feel like you're in the house with a large family. You can hear every noise, including babies crying, early in the morning. People tried to come in our room several times "thinking it was empty," including both guests and staff! Perhaps that was in part because other rooms had to share a bathroom? We had a private bathroom... But with no door. People trying to get into our room was very off-putting. Hard to communicate with staff. The staff tried to be accommodating, though communication in English was very difficult and no French or Swahili, either.

title: Nice place to stay in Kigali
review: Could improve their breakfast and shower door was broken. Host was very helpful, we got early check in at no extra charge plus they allowed us to leave our luggage there for the full day when we were leaving because our flight was late. Wifi was working really good. Very big and comfortable bed and terrace.

It was so loud I barely slept. People kept trying to come into my room and I couldn’t get breakfast at all on my second day. It’s a shame as the area is quite buzzy. The bed was comfortable but I was eaten alive despite the mosquito net.

title: I ve liked the place, clean and nice with comfort.
review: The only challenge was for the wifi...They gave me a router for the first day but one of the staff didn’t give it to me and she told me to use the poorest wifi ever. I ve liked the place, clean and nice with comfort. The manager’s way of hospitality is so adorable 😊

title: Average
review: I did not like that I had to stay in another guest house in my first night. Morever, I was charged for the transportation from the guest house I stayed in the first night to the Happy Hour. It was also not nice. There was no WiFi in the facility. Not in my room, not in the restaurant! If I attempted to connect to WiFi 20 times, I just could only once; for very short time. There was something I had to do on the internet during my stay in Kigali but I could not complete it. Now I have to stay more in Kampala for this and pay extra money. But please remember that it is cheap to stay there. The score I give for this place is 6,3 and it is very good for the price I paid for 5 nights. So, good value for money! Employees are friendly and nice people. They do their best to help you. I liked the restaurant. Foods and prices are good. To go to touristic places you can take mototaxi. You will have to pay like 1-2 dollars for one way.

title: Good accommodation with outdoor pool.
review: Single bed was small and it was hot in the room overnight with no fan. Also no mosquito nets but there was a plug in mosquito repellent which only seemed to help my friend who was closest to it. Pool was good and good breakfast. The receptionist was able to change our room type on arrival which wasn't available online when we booked.  Very helpful staff. Lots of space in lounge and eating area.

title: Clean but basic
review: The lack of running water for 2 mornings and only a cold tap in the bathroom sink. When water was running it still took ages to have a shower.  During my stay the hotel was very noisy as full of teenage students. The room was clean and tidy every day.

title: It was a pleasant stay, and despite the water issue, I would recommend the place.
review: The room (on a higher floor) runs out of water around 9ish, so it's better to have your shower before 8am. First time I ran out of water in the bathroom room, they told me that it was a pump problem, then sent someone to my room to fix it. One of the staff members offered me to change the room, but as the water returned, another receptionist assured me that it was not going to happen again, so I chose to stay, but it did. In the following days I discovered that it was not a one off situation. - I usually had water until around 9am, then the water would be back in the pipes early afternoon, all night and early morning... until around 9am. As I usually spent most of the day out it was ok, but it was not nice the way the staff handled the situatiation, not being straight forward about the real situation. The street that takes us to the hotel is not paved and there's no street light, so walking to the hotel at night can be a bit complicated as you are not sure where you are stepping and because the road is very uneven. In spite of the dark I felt safe. I was charged for a "taxe de sejour" that was not mentioned on my booking.com reservation, and this was a surprise as VAT was already included and Booking.com did not informe me that I would need to pay extra taxes. This taxe de sejour cost me nearly the price of another night. As I haven't found so far any information about hotels in Rwanda charging Taxe de sejour, I'm not sure if it is a Rwandan policy or if it is a Rouge by Desir policy. In any case, Bookin.com should inform us about any extra taxes, fees. The room was big, very clean, and had a beautiful view. Students of a local university live in the hotel, giving it an extra touch, a lively home feeling. It was nice to arrive at the hotel in the evening and see the students on the lounge working on their computers and chatting. The staff members are polite. The hotel is located in a good and safe neighbourhood, with supermarket and places to eat about 5 minute-walk or even less.It was pleasant to sit at the balcony and read. There is a big and nice swimming pool.

title: The pool and restaurants are really nice.
review: The rooms need proper care and renovation and then the hotel will be top quality if they can maintain  good customer service. Also, the water pump is very noisy and the shower leaked all over the floor. The pool and restaurants are really nice.

title: If you want somewhere cheap and cheerful, Rouge by Desir is it.
review: On arrival there was confusion with our booking which took some time to resolve, and there was no hairdryer  in our room. Big pool, staff could speak good English, tasty breakfast with real English tea, they  had a coffee shop, sports bar, everything  you need to be honest.  It was one of the better hotels we stayed in and extremely reasonable

title: Excellent would recommend to everyone. Worth the money -  reliable WiFi, free breakfast, great staff
review: The bathrooms are quite small and the bed quite low and slightly creaky (well for a big person) The staff have been amazing and very helpful especially Chris at the reception and Jackie the manager.

title: Great view of the city and cool environment
review: The sockets in the rooms dont support 3 plug cables only support 2 plug the amenities that Rouge provides especially the swimming pool and good music

title: Great value for your money
review: Breakfast options very limited Great value for your money

title: good, friendly.
review: cost cleanliness

title: The swimming pool and the breakfast.
review: No water available. Noise all night long. Not really helpful staff.  The swimming pool and the breakfast. Good internet connection

title: Enjoyed my stay
review:
You have to pay in advance  Great Breakfast 
Relaxing at the pool
Friendly staff

title: It was clean, comfortable and the staff were very friendly...
review: Nothing.  No complaints.   It was clean, comfortable and the staff were very friendly and accommodating.  Great value for the money.

title: It's a nice quiet place to stay.
review: In regards to breakfast, I do hope you will improve the only Omelet to other preference. Steam Bath is really good with a charming welcome from the staff.

title: Modest hotel at a modorate cost
review: Room not fresh, i had to request for a change of the room because the first i got was having three separate beds and evidently was not used for a long time. The green enviroment well kept. Ezekiel is a great help in the restaurant and bar.

title: Comfortable stay at budget Stipp Kiyovu
review: Breakfast not diverse. Stale juice and no sausage and bacon for kids. The pool is small and the hotel very squeezed.  Rooms spacious though not well aired

title: Excellent customer care
review: The food is way too expensive as compared to current food rates None

title: This place is badly run down and in need oref a revanmp  It was certainly was not value for money
review: Dingy, dark room, broken TV, hard mattress, poor and slow service and disappointing breakfast. It's convenient location near the Tennis Centre

title: There wasn't a air conditionning and the Jacusi...
review: None There wasn't a air conditionning and the Jacusi didn't retain water

title: Breakfast
review: The door could not open Breakfast

title: The place was pretty run-down
review: The place was pretty run-down None

title: The garden setting was pleasant, most of the staff were...
review:
A dog and a cat walking around dining area, loud music playing for most of the day and late into the evening, traffic noise on the main road,
I had to wait over two hours to be served a bowl of soup! The garden setting was pleasant, most of the staff were polite and friendly

title: Not again.
review: The room was very dirty and absolutely not cozy. It was very loud and the whole Hotel seems to Be very old and used. The Manager was careful and friendly.

title: Good location.
review: Holes in the mosquito net and a little grubby overall!  Good location. If you are looking for budget accommodation it is a good choice, the breakfast included is also very good.

title: good for its price
review: None Amazing staff, really helpfull and caring.For a tight budget, its really a good place. Everything is from 5 up to 20minutes by motocycle, for around 0.50$ up to 2$ to move. The rooms are small, but you have a bed, a night stand, and space for your stuff. For the hot water, ask in advance that they turn it on (I thought there was no hot water the first evening). Food is also nice and very affordable.

title: Originality, hospitality and unbeatable value in Kigali
review: Very minor considerations: rooms don't have much storage space, shower is cold water, no TV in the room Colors has an originality and quirkiness that is very appealing. Staff are friendly, helpful, agreable and laid back. Great hospitality (owner met me at airport with a taxi at 1am). Tremendous value, safe, clean and comfortable, breakfast included, Wifi in common areas works great, no problems with water. Lots of places to lounge inside & outside in the garden and have a beer. Supermarkets and shops just a short walk away. If your the finicky sort that can only be happy in a 5 star hotel in the tourist zone go somewhere else. If you want something casual and down-to-earth with a character all its own, this is your place.

title: Not a decent place
review:
The room was stinky and dirty. We caught security guy staring at our window, which was creepy as there was just a grass and a fence, so he had no other reason to wonder there. He was denying it later. That was incredibly creepy. 
There was a remainings of a smashed dead lizard on the wall. 
The water was cold.  Well located: close to the airport and the market

title: Paradise for budget travelers
review: None Paradise for budget travelers. A good balance between cost and quality. In such low price, someone can only get a dormitory room with shared toilet! But I got my own room with attached toilet and hot water shower. As I informed them about my early checkout, they served breakfast quickly and called a taxi for me. Staff was very caring. I read some negative comments earlier about this place but after staying this place I realize that it may be unfair to compare this budget hotel to other overpriced hotel. Sometime people may have high expectations regardless how much price they pay.

title: Good staff. Fair budget choice, but very much a "budget" hotel
review: Some rooms nicer than othersMusic from the bar the the garden until 11pmGot a sense that it's lost some of it's earlier glory, but this is a similar experience in many hotels in Rwanda.As one of the cheapest places in Kigali you are getting what you pay for, so just depends on what your budget is Nice staffGood food

title: Staff were sweet and friendly.
review: The room was smelly and dirty. There were old soaps left on the basin, and the bath was grubby. We spotted a chicken carcass on a plate on the floor in the kitchen area. By the bathroom in the restaurant area, there were over-flowing rubbish bags left out. At night, the place was noisy. Staff were sweet and friendly.

title: Need improvement ...
review: No water supply in bathroom and not informed about the same .in morning dey have me water in buckets.but yes in 11 dollar ,I think this is what we should expect. Staff was warm and caring

title: Amazing experience!
review:
None Amazing place, nice staff to talk and discover more about Rwanda. 
Good prices, not only for the accommodation but also for the beer and food in the bar/restaurant . We came for a couple of days, but ended up more than a week here. 
On overall, one of the best experiences traveling in Africa.

title: Inside Dali's head))
review: There wasn't anything I disliked)) This is a crazy place, imagine being in Salvador Dali's head and you get the picture. It's basic but you get what you pay for. The people working there are super friendly and helpful.

title: Best Hotel in Kigali
review: None Staff is available every time to help, owner is very friendly and cooperative. When you visit Kigali this must be your hotel if you want a memorable trip.

title: Good place
review: There is not that much to see and do in the area. You need to take a taxi. The staff was really professional, good and welcoming. I found the hotel pretty basic, but this was compensated by its charm. There is a restaurant attached to the hotel and the food is excellent, as well as the services.

title: The staff was great, but place is tired and desperately needs a renovation.
review: There was no water the first night, so we couldn't shower after we arrived. Rooms are clean, but very simple and tired, therefore do not feel nice. Our bed was extremely uncomfortable. Mattress was really old and needed to be changed as we were feeling bed frame underneath us. Whole place screems in need of renovation. The staff was amazing. Very friendly and helpful. Breakfast was made to order. Garden is lovely and beer is cheap.

title: We’re going back next week.
review: Water shortage in the area so showers not working. They brought us water to wash. Wonderful people and wonderful setting. Lots of plants and grass. Great food and the prices were low. Good place for budget travelers

title: Big garden, own bathroom in the room, great breakfast and...
review: Needs a face wash, music too loud sometimes Big garden, own bathroom in the room, great breakfast and they are very nice to bring it any time in the morning you ask even early in the morning as 6am

title: Nice staff with luck of everything
review: The pictures you see are made long time ago.Place is quite run down and the level of cleanliness is questionable. Friendly staff who will assist you with any questions you may have.

title: Affordable stay in Kigali for business traveler, delicious breakfast is icing on cake
review: None Facilities are good enough looking at price, Free Breakfast is bonus. I enjoyed doing my work on laptop in their beautiful garden. For a business traveler like me, Free Wifi, laptop charging points and easy access to public transport is important. As I am to visit Kigali several times in 2018 for my project, I don't need to look any other place.

title: Best place to stay for family with young kids
review: None The best thing I liked was the beautiful garden with Kid's park. My 7 years old daughter Hanna enjoyed Swing & Slides and Craft Place. I believe she was more happy than me finding other kids playing with cute Rabbits, Ducks, Turtles and following pigeons. It was best Christmas holiday for her. Normally hotels think about  grown up guests ignoring kids but this place has a lot for kids. As a mother, I find this place ideal for family stay specially if you are traveling with young kids.

title: True value for money in an overpriced city like Kigali!
review: None True value for money in an overpriced city like Kigali. The property is located in a quiet neighbourhood of Kimironko, just 10 mins from the airport. All places in the city centre is just a 10 minute / 1000 Rwf moto ride away, and we really loved the fact that we were away from the city chaos. The place has a great outdoor space overlooking a valley giving tremendous views, especially during sunset. The staff are really friendly and the food prepared by the local kitchen is good quality (especially the Indian). The rooms were basic, but clean and spacious enough. During our 1 month stay in Rwanda, all our visits back to Kigali were spent here. Other hotels in the city charge twice the rate for the same facilities, so we would have no hesitation in coming back to this space in the future!

title: Ok
review: I woke up with no electricity and no running water ! I had to wait a long time to get them.Too bad for these two very important elements missing in the morning The staff was niceBreakfast was good

title: Good value for money!
review: Despite the mosquito nets, there were a lot of mosquitos in my room, especially in the bathroom. This may be a seasonal thing. Also, the hot water did not seem to be working in my room so it was a cold shower. The breakfast was very nice and most of the staff was incredibly helpful with figuring out how to get to the destinations I was looking to goto. The location is also fairly straightforward, and there is lots of moto traffic on the road so it is easy to pickup a moto taxi.

title: Underwhelmed
review: No where near as advertised, and too much money for what you get. Was supposed to get a room with a veranda, which I paid for but got stuck in the back, crappy little room, worn out mattress, 2 people rolled to the middle all night, no mattress pad, dirty sheets, no hot water as promised, lot's of mosquitoes, holes in the mosquito net let the bugs in, loud music from the so called on sight disco 10 meters away, kept us awake, but the worst thing was the surly staff. When the cats away the mice will play, without the owner being there some staff members could just care less about you. They'd rather sit at the bar and talk than give you the time of day. Very frustrating. Management needs to train these people better or risk losing lots of business. There were 2 staff members who did provide excellent customer service and I would like to commend them on the great job they did,but overall I'd never go back there and recommend you consider selecting another property. The hotel printemps up the hill on 11th street is a nice place, quiet and only about 10$a night more with a nice bar and great food, comfortable rooms in a whole other class from colors. Sometimes the cheapest option is not the best choice. Live and learn.  Location was good, close to everything you need, just a few minutes walk away from restaurants and bus and taxi stands. Phone sim cards and groceries. The food was very good especially the Indian food and pizza. The free massage was nice too. The owner was very friendly, but mostly never there. Airport pick up was $15.

title: Enjoyable experience with warm friendly staff
review: Shower in room to work with hot water Value for money.Owner and Manager extremely helpful going out of their way to accommodate us even making special effort to assist with communication with locals

title: Kigali rocks
review: Would have liked my room to be near the shower... The staff were very friendly,the location was within reach of public transport, didn't get a chance to eat the chicken curry, but one of the other travellers from Tanzania, swore by it :)Oh well maybe next time...

title: Above and beyond expectations
review: None The staff were extremely personable, the facility was very basic but done well, and we especially enjoyed the included breakfasts. :) Thank you!

title: MAGNIFICIENT
review: STAFF ATTITUDE AND QUICK RESPONSE TO NEED THE STAFF AND EVERYTHING FROM THE OWNER MANAGER DELPHINE TO THE CLEANERS SO ACCOMMODATING AND VERY NICE

title: For this price-super.
review: None For this price-super. No problem, personal was very helpful.

title: Team is good
review: Its far and not clean  Team is good

title: Okay. May stay there next time when I have such low budget
review: Mosquitoes! Too much. Water and heated water unreliable and epileptic. Good friendly staff. Owner very friendly, courteous and helpful.

title: Breakfast was good
review: No hot water Breakfast was good

title: Best Hotel in Kigali
review: None Owner, staff, food, comfort and location. Everything is perfect and above expectations of every budget traveller.

title: Best Place in Kigali for Budget Traveler

title: I loved the uniqueness of the ace and the friendliness of...
review: WiFi often didn't work I loved the uniqueness of the ace and the friendliness of the staff. I was also happy to see two sweet doggies!

title: Ideal place for budget travellers

title: Avoid to go there

title: The warm welcome by the chef se la cuisine, who stayed up...
review: A little difficult to find, very complicated if GPS and internet don't work in Rwanda. The warm welcome by the chef se la cuisine, who stayed up until 1am (!!) To help. A very intelligent and knowledgeable man.

title: Wow, i like the hospitality, i was really at home, Ernes and Joseph, you are truelly brothers
review: Nothing at all Wow, i like the hospitality, i was really at home, Ernes and Joseph, you are truelly brothers, am coming back on october for some work, and december for vacation with 8 friends, love you all, big up, i have to extend my stay for 10 more days

title: I will definitely go back to GISA STAY 102
review: The water pump has to be on for you to take a shower and since there is no phone in the room, you have to go down and ask that they put it on.The shower basin is small allowing alot of water on the floor Staff were very helpful and warm

title: The place was beautiful, excellent customer service!
review: The bathroom needs a shower curtain, so the entire bathroom floor does not get wet. In addition, the beds, despite being extremely comfortable, had bed bugs. I was bitten 23 times during the course of the two nights that we resided there. The place was beautiful, excellent customer service!

title: Fabulous
review: None Staff are amazing in their services and has that family feel.  Enjoyed good dinner cooked by one of the staff

title: Stayed one night and moved out
review: Bed was made up of old pallets and there was no running water None

title: My stay was great
review: I like everything The apartment was very nice. And All the staffs are very nice especially Joseph. Their food is very good.

title: A very neat and comfortable environment, friendly staff, a...
review: None A very neat and comfortable environment, friendly staff, a good and affordable meal.

title: This is home away from home😍
review: It's kinda far from the city center but manageable. This is home away from home😍

title: The staffs were very friendly.
review: There are some days were no water in the place. The staffs were very friendly.

title: It’s a new place but if they continue like this it’s gonna be a super host.
review: The freedom to interact with every one. The staff was so friendly and homely.

title: Wonderful meals
review:
None Wonderful meals
Wonderful and calm place
Wonderful staff

title: Staff was nice
review: Location was far away. 3 days without any water. Big room

title: Gisa 102 Pimps
review: The house itself, the staff and the ambience was amazing... The house itself, the staff and the ambience was amazing...will definately come back..

title: Generally great -- but sleeping very difficult due to noise -- bring good quality earplugs!
review: Room has permanently open windows (vents) and the street life is very noisy all hours of the night, including bar music until 4am -- so it is very difficult to sleep well. Staff very kind and helpful, breakfast very good, location central, room comfortable and clean

title: Everything is just wonderful!
review: None The location is central and convenient to get around,and the room is clean with comfy beds. I'd like to mention their service specially -just fabulous! We ran into problems of luggage delays with Kenya Airways,and the hotel staff have helped us constantly and patiently to get everything done. They are like angels! :-)

title: The place was quite spacious and comfortable.
review: I will recommend they provide at least one bottle of water daily. I was provided for three days out of five days. Am sure it was just and oversight.  The place was quite spacious and comfortable.

title: Over all its Values  for money
review: No fan /cooler  in room no lift  for old people  reaching 3rd floor will be a difficult Some day they don't  put complimentary water bottle  in room Small small issue  if they correct  they are the best as per location and price Location  is very good for business  person or moving in city area price wise good if peoples want to move around whole day and only come for sleep  in room

title: The hotel was fine, however in the restaurant one waits for one's meal.  Menu price is unclear.
review: The restaurant service and matching of prices on the menu need to match what you are charged.  Paid 4500 for French fries and a mini salad.  On the menu it said 2500. States below-service for evening meals slow and inconsistent.

title: Good budget hotel
review: No comments Clean hotel friendly staff. Gives directions accurate to where u want to go bus park very near so easy access to nearby countries almost in business district nice view of city from restaurants nearby shops walking distance

title: It was magical
review: Internet at the restaurant was abit slow but all in all it was good The bed was so comfortable,the internet was good, i loved the hospitality the staff gave me and the food awas good. Looking forward to visiting the place again

title: Its fairly clean hotel with nice reception for guests. Keep up with the good work..
review: It is near city center i mean not far but a bit second road. Saturday night there is ouside noise in neighborhood but the property itself is quite. The cleanness of rooms, kind reception, modest and fair priced dishes and in addition nice view of city with good breath of air from restaurant at dinner time.

title: Its nice clean hotel with a good breathing and sightly view of the city of Kigali with tasty dishes.
review: The receptionists are kind and helpful. The waitresses are also clean and comfy. There is clean room and bathroom. Clean matts and comfortable mattresses.

title: The staff, service and breakfast is real value for money and...
review: Actually there was nothing I can say anything I did not like The staff, service and breakfast is real value for money and I could live in the centre of Kigali City

title: Decent place to stay Downtown Kigali
review: No heating / electric jug in the room; no complementary mineral water; Nice location, friendly place. Very friendly staff. Clean rooms, comfy beds, spacious room & generous balcony;Staff commendation: Denice at the reception is friendly & very helpful; Peruth (meaning humble & beautiful) was a joy & delight to have around in the restaurant and bonus for the friendly welcome from the security guard! :)Basic Facilities in the room & Basic breakfast buffet available (including fresh fruit & tasty soup - their unique offering)

title: The hotel in very central and has great views over the city...
review: None The hotel in very central and has great views over the city from the room we stayed in.  It feels safe and well run and breakfast was really good (home made soup, omelettes, bread, coffee fruit etc).  The staff are welcoming and friendly. We stayed twice at this hotel - really enjoyed it!

title: so good
review: There are few visible channels on TVThe Wi-fi connection is not always good at the roomThere are a few varieties of breakfast Staff are so kindthe room is so cleanthe landscape is beautiful

title: OK for one night. Reasonable clean and comfortable.
review: A bit of noise and loud music at night from the nearby nightclub and the locals shouting in the road. Not good. The TV and satellite box didn't work. What's the point in having it in the room, it's just hunk and gets in the way. The room had a musty smell and the bathroom does need improvement, but for one night it was fine.  The staff were very friendly and the breakfast was good. Location is ideal to catch a motorcycle taxi or car taxi from the next road up.

title: Restaurant has an amazing view good WiFi and amazing staff. Budget hotel with bathroom let down
review: The light in the hall was off so has to use my cell as a torch to get key in the door. Decor in room was very dated. Old style TV which did not work. I did not inform them because I didn't want to watch TV. No toiletries except a small soap bar in a sealed packet. The biggest let down was the bathroom. Broken tiles and yellow stained toilet. Broken toilet seat. Taps in shower and bath were leaking. No hot water at basin. Hot water at bath. The bath had stains and was not looking very nice. Did not use it at all... Reception was awesome. Clerk was efficient and knowledgeable. Wifi was good. Room was very clean and tidy. Bed was made with clean white sheets.breakfast was nice. Fresh juice, fruit and 3 other dishes. Including a beef stew with very delicious sauce which I ate with scrambled eggs. Coffee and tea avail with milk and honey. My transport was only scheduled for 1230 and the owner offered to let me use the room free of charge until my taxi arrived since checkout is at 10. I opted to walk around cbd for my last few hours in Kigali.

title: It was below expectation and I moved out after a day
review: The WiFi didn't work in the room and you had to stay in the hallway to get network.The TV had few channels I think about 3 ,they need to upgrade to include English speaking channels and have sports, CNN,movies ,cartoons etc.The hotel had an old look about it,renovation is needed, from the keys used to lock doors to the soap in the bathroom. The balcony attached to the room was nice and had a great view.

title: Friendly staff, conveniently located budget hotel
review: It is a bit loud, the noise from the street really carries into the room. There are mosquitoes so be sure to use the mosquito net! The room lacked a bit in cleanliness- the chair cushion and duvet were very worn and the tv remote was rather grimy. Shower tiles could use a good cleaning as well. The staff were extremely kind and attentive, from the moment I arrived until after I left. They helped arrange pick-up and were flexible since I was arriving by bus. They held my bag for me all day after check out until the evening and even helped me find my phone charger that I had left behind. The breakfast was fresh, healthy and delicious. I booked a budget double and it was more spacious than I expected and had a small balcony as well. Convenient location for anyone arriving to Kigali by bus.

title: Dirty and ugly rooms, not recommended
review: We booked budget room and they willing to give us room with moldy walls and in the underground and asked for upgrade addtional 30usd. After complaint they changed the room. Our upgraded room was dirty and old, reconstruction really needed. Breakfast quite poor. Im surprised that booking.com offer such a place. Wifi was warking very well. Good quality restaurant inside but be prepare to wait 1 hour for your food.

title: Not great, not bad but fine for the price.
review: Restaurant serviceBudget rooms are bad The hotel was a mixed bag really. The upsides were the restaurant downstairs serving decent food and the room was of a good standard with a great balcony. You have to remember to order your food at least an hour before you want it as the service is ridiculously slow! but this does seem to be Rwanda on a whole. The staff are friendly enough if a little stand offish. I booked a budget single and it was fairly ropey so I upgraded and it was worth the extra cost. The Manageress is great, deal with her!

title: Nice hotel and surrounding, no knowledge of tourist attractions
review: There is no touristic awareness, e.g. no city maps, no knowledge of tourist attractions and so on. You must look hard to find them The staff and especially the wonderful manageress were nice and cooperative, The suite we got was very comfortable and the hotel restuarant was good,close to main bus station (10 minutes by taxi)

title: The rooms were spacious, the restaurant at the hotel has...
review: There were too many mosquitoes at the restaurant, though rooms are provided with Mosquito net. When we arrived the lady at the reception showed us very filthy rooms claiming that is what we booked though they did not match the pics on their site. These rooms were are at the adjacent building down the hotel at the back side. We were asked if we would like to upgrade our rooms to $60 per night which were the ones shown as their property on booking.com. Our booking rooms were $35 per night including breakfast. The rooms shown first at the adjacent building were having no ventilation, broken toilets, filthy bed sheets etc. When we refused to pay anything extra and insisted on provinding us the rooms shown on their booking.com site, they obliged without charging us anything extra and we got rooms we booked as per pics. I assume it is a rip off scam to try to convince customers to pay extra without realising they are being ripped off. Ultimately we were provided clean rooms and our stay was excellent but this trick of theirs made us left with suspicision. Other than that the location and views from the hotel are excellent. The rooms were spacious, the restaurant at the hotel has nice and tasty food. Views from the hotel of the city are excellent. The staff was cordial and nice.

title: The manager and probably owner was very helpful.
review: Loud music until 02.30.When there at 01.30 they proposed a different rate room than the one booked (80$ instead of 50$). The booked was on a side "building" without security and the proposed when there, it was on the 2nd floor of the main building with security. The manager and probably owner was very helpful. Next morning she arranged to stay without paying a difference in the main building. They allowed us to have "mini" breakfast at 03.00 am when it was necessary to catch an early morning bus.

title: My honest comment .
review: Towels given were not clean , very old  . I was not given any airport shuttle even if it was shown  during booking . I cannot recommend  it to any one and  I will never stay . nothing .

title: Decent hotel near downtown
review: The breakfast was just OK, rather than excellent. The hotel is in a good location and the staff are very friendly.  However, the prices are a bit high.

title: Right within the town centre
review: The toilet has a window that links into the room. Embarrassing if you have a guest in the room and the toilet is being used. Right within the town centre

title: Nice stay !
review: Initially slightly disappointed with my single budget room and was being upsold, but finally given an upgrade for free.  Felt the prices were high but seems like Kigali is like that.  For the prices being offered, some colour could be added to the otherwise sufficiently functional rooms.  So my main ding here is value for money, but its quite nice otherwise. Outstanding breakfast, more than I was expecting.  Also, a lovely and nicely priced placed for a bite any time of the day with sweet staff.The staff, whether in the room, the reception, the manager, the doormen, to the restaurant (both breakfast or all day / evening) were always saying 'yes' and very helpful.  Some good tips received on what to do, and where to get out, and always in a nice friendly way.  Good sleep.  Even the street view is nice.

title: Yep
review: Nothing Okay

title: Interesting,  fulfilling,  best value for money and accessible .
review: No airconditioner. Cleanliness.  And quick response of staff

title: Nine
review: Nice reception  Nine

title: Staff were so excellent and arranged a seamless pickup from...
review: None Staff were so excellent and arranged a seamless pickup from the airport. Great wifi! Clean rooms and exactly what we needed.

title: Very good service and it is at heart of down town
review:
No lift or elevator  Nice big clean room, strong WiFi
Staff at the property are helpful and nice.

title: What you pay is what you get. The place and services are worth or even better than what you pay for.
review: Poor WiFi, noise of vehicle passing. Visitors are well received. The staff is kind and you get value for money.

title: Fantastic place to stay
review: Nothing not to like. Fantastic place to stay.  Staff were great. Food was great   Room was spotlessly clean and great location.   Great stay

title: Good stay
review: View from my room and slow water heating Clean room and fast Wi-Fi

title: Over all it was good comparing room rate per night
review: Behavior of resturant staff Dealing of Reception staffs Internet seevice

title: Good and affordable
review: Nothing really Basic amenities

title: The sparkling clean rooms, staircase and corridors.
review:
Poor internet connectivity occasionally The sparkling clean rooms, staircase and corridors.
Warm reception and committed staff

title: The hotel sis clean and new, beds are comfy and pillows are...
review:
Limited food options at the bar. The hotel sis clean and new, beds are comfy and pillows are nice and soft.
Was next to the convention Centre so very convenient if you are attending an event in KCC.

company_name: Radisson Blu Hotel & Convention Centre Kigali
title: Convenient to conference centre- but nowhere else and cabs...
review:
Soulless 
Poor Italian restaurant 
Miles
From anywhere apart from conference centre - town about 5k up and down endless hills  Convenient to conference centre- but nowhere else and cabs were expensive. 
Fabulous receptionists and administrators - particularly Gisele! Incredibly helpful to guests.

company_name: Radisson Blu Hotel & Convention Centre Kigali
title: The business lounge very warm and quite
review: Transfer from hotel to airport delay I paid and reserved my transfer by the hotel Chauffeur service and ended up using a hired private Taxi which is double cost. Very Un professional like The business lounge very warm and quite

company_name: Radisson Blu Hotel & Convention Centre Kigali
title: Comfortable, relaxing stay.
review:
I had requested for twin beds but was checked into a room with a king bed. Finding a suitable room took awhile. The staff were courteous and ready to help (Kudos to Naphtal and Aissa).
I was allowed to stay in the king bed room until my request for a twin bed room was met.
The views from the hotel are really good.

company_name: Radisson Blu Hotel & Convention Centre Kigali
title: Over priced for what it was and would not stay again.
review: I thought staff were poor, the facilities were very poor and food was mediocre at best. Limited menu and the quality of what was served was poor. OK, in terms of location and reasonably central.

company_name: Radisson Blu Hotel & Convention Centre Kigali
title: Just ok.
review: Air conditioning was very poor. The perimeter fence made it impossible to take a short walk across to the shops. It felt like being confined to a prison.Staff weren’t particularly responsive to requests for information. Air conditioning aside, the room was comfortable, breakfast was excellent.

company_name: Radisson Blu Hotel & Convention Centre Kigali
title: Was denied the snacks and water available at the reception,...
review: Was denied the snacks and water available at the reception, since I had already checked in. I was told it was for checking in clients only! I thought that was mean. None

company_name: Radisson Blu Hotel & Convention Centre Kigali
title: Anonymous
review: Check in and  check out take took long.  Residents not being allowed on other floors affects connection to the Conference centre on the 1st floor.  We can be denied entry to the rooms side but all residents should be able to use bridge to conference centre...hence lift should allow all on that floor.   Very friendly staff, and the property is simple but beautiful. The area is also safe.

company_name: Radisson Blu Hotel & Convention Centre Kigali
title: After I had traveled some African countries, this
review: None The whole hotel is organized to meet the guests expectations. Specially the stuff cares a lot, and everybody I dealt with was Professional.The Building is baautiful and the rooms very calm.

company_name: Radisson Blu Hotel & Convention Centre Kigali

review: None The whole hotel is organized to meet the guests expectations. Specially the stuff cares a lot, and everybody I dealt with was Professional.The Building is baautiful and the rooms very calm.

company_name: Radisson Blu Hotel & Convention Centre Kigali
title: Lovely
review: None The staff was professional and welcoming. They remembered my name, anticipated my needs and exceeded my expectations. My room was emaculate and was prepared with everything I could have asked for when I arrived. The decor is beautiful. My room was relaxing. I appreciated that in addition to traditional international faire, the hotel prepared a wide variety of local dishes for me to enjoy each morning. The food was amazing.Foreign heads of state were also guests of the hotel while I was visiting so security was tight. I appreciated feeling safe being so far from home.

company_name: Radisson Blu Hotel & Convention Centre Kigali
title: I enjoyed staying with you, look forward to visit again in near months to come.
review: on the main toilet cube, try to fix water slush hose that can be used to clean your self after the toilet paper use, it is important. Services / clean environment / security.

company_name: Radisson Blu Hotel & Convention Centre Kigali
title: My short stay
review: The Toiket do not have Bidet Shower/Spray The location of the Hotel, Security and the cleanliness, the swimming pool and above all, the Hotel staffs are very good and excellent

company_name: Radisson Blu Hotel & Convention Centre Kigali
title: Deserves another chance despite a sub-standard stay
review: We were rather unlucky with our room, a few things were not working as they were supposed to, including the air-conditioning, toilet and shower and we only noticed during the night when it was too late to change to another room, which I am certain would have happened. We did get a credit of points for a free night on our membership card, unfortunately it still made for a bad night, thus the review. The look & feel of the place is very nice, good facilities including a couple of restaurants and bar with outside seating; in good proximity to airport. The safety is excellent, there is a high security check-point when coming into the property.

company_name: Radisson Blu Hotel & Convention Centre Kigali
title: Wonderful
review: They took my bathrobe and never replaced it :( The manager Esperance is very lovely and has a warm heart. Her reception made my stay worth while. Also to recommend Fred for always ensuring my room is set and ready

company_name: Radisson Blu Hotel & Convention Centre Kigali
title: The service is poor.
review: Service could be much, much better.Food taste is not that great The service is poor. Not sure how well trained is the staff. Though I have had a very Senior person, Mr Ba,  who cares but that was at the very end of the stay

company_name: Radisson Blu Hotel & Convention Centre Kigali
title: Not worth the price you pay.
review: Transportation from the airport to the hotel did not arrive. Contacted the hotel, and they said they were sending a car, and it would be 10 minutes. After waiting for 1 hour, we had to take a taxi on our own, at our own expense. Hotel did not reimburse us for this even though we had booked a hotel shuttle to pick us up at the airport.Rooms are very small for the price you pay. Beverages are double the normal prices in Kigali. Security was like going through the airport every time you tried to enter the hotel. It was too much, and really became a hassle. Hotel staff was very nice. They provided a golf cart ride to your car.Rooms are very quiet and beds were comfortable. Internet was good.Food was good, but very pricey.

company_name: Radisson Blu Hotel & Convention Centre Kigali
title: It was an amazing stay.
review: Nothing...I enjoyed my stay The African tea was a first! And i loved it

company_name: Radisson Blu Hotel & Convention Centre Kigali
